brief_summary.textblock:
To assess the potential value of alpha-1-acid glycoprotein (AGP) for early diagnosis and
      prognosis of patients with sepsis, and then compared with C-reactive protein (CRP),
      procalcitonin (PCT), white blood cell (WBC) counts, Acute Physiology and Chronic Health
      Evaluation (APACHE) II score and Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score. 164
      patients were enrolled in the study, including 25 cases with systemic inflammatory response
      syndrome (SIRS) and 139 cases with different levels of sepsis (46 moderate sepsis, 52 severe
      sepsis and 41 septic shock ). Serum levels of Alpha-1-acid Glycoprotein (AGP), C-reactive
      protein (CRP), and procalcitonin (PCT), and white blood cell (WBC) counts were measured on
      the day of admission to intensive care unit (ICU).

clinical_study.brief_title: Alpha-1-acid Glycoprotein as a Biomarker of Developmental Diagnosing and Monitoring Effectiveness in Sepsis

study_pop.textblock:
Between April 2011 and APRIL 2013, inpatients were included who were in the intensive care
        units (ICU) of the Department of Respiratory Disease (RICU), the Emergency Department
        (EICU), and the Department of Surgery (SICU) of the Chinese People's Liberation Army
        General Hospital.

overall_official.affiliation: Department Of Respiratory Diseases, Chinese PLA General Hospital

primary_outcome.description: The survival time of patients more than 28 days is defined as survival. The survival time of patients less than 28 days is defined as death

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
